2 Text: a^(p-1) ≡ 1 (mod p) for prime p, when gcd(a,p)=1.
a^φ(n) ≡ 1 (mod n) for gcd(a,n)=1. Generalizes Fermat.

1 Text: What is the Discrete Logarithm Problem (DLP)?
2 Text: Given g, h, n: find x where g^x ≡ h (mod n).

1 Text: What two hardness assumptions does cryptography rely on?
2 Text: Integer Factorization (RSA) and Discrete Logarithm (DH, ElGamal, DSA, ECC).

1 Text: Are factoring and DLP proven hard?
2 Text: No. Believed hard but not proven. Cryptography rests on computational assumptions.

1 Text: What algorithm tests if a number is prime?

2 Text: Prime p where (p-1)/2 is also prime.

1 Text: What would P = NP mean for cryptography?
2 Text: Many cryptosystems broken. Factoring and DLP would be easy.

1 Text: What is the Fundamental Theorem of Arithmetic?
2 Text: Every integer has unique prime factorization.
Numbers that are perfect squares mod n. Used in advanced protocols.
